oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sphericity of a real hypersurface via projective geometry
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kossovskiy, Ilya
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Complex Variables
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this work, we obtain an unexpected geometric characterization of sphericity of a real-analytic Levi-nondegenerate hypersurface $M\subset\mathbb C^{2}$. We prove that $M$ is spherical if and only if its Segre\,(-Webster) varieties satisfy an elementary combinatorial property, identical to a property of straight lines on the plane and known in Projective Geometry as the {\em Desargues Theorem}.
